text: Yes, I do. Use the HubSpot JS form (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/advanced_form_options>) on your "third-party" website. Of course, IANAL (nor know your location US/EU/blah) ensure that the end customer is aware of this as you are using browser geo-location and the fields won't be *hidden* right? :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi all - did anyone else find the HubSpot developer preview form survey a bit odd? I was hoping to have some fields for suggestions but for some reason (I may have pressed not being a developer) - there was no opportunity to suggest things

> my suggestion was be able to generate "Meeting links" on the fly using the API. Two of my customers have this use case.

hey <@U22PKFRU5> just noticed that you are Dev Rel here! fab! must be pretty interesting doing devrel for HS as there's lots of products/APIs to push and promote! What do you think about this? Did I select a dodgy option>?
Hey all, I am using google lighthouse to test website's performance and it recommended me to Minimize main thread work .. do you have any idea how to do that on HubSpot ?
are you doing this to achieve SEO performance?
If your app is live on the web I could have a look at profiling the main thread so I can see if that is to do with HS

What service are you using to get the address based on the IP? I dont want to save it into hidden fields but the opposite, i want the preloaded address to be the default and then the user can modify it
Thanks <@U25C65C3S> - is the membership an additional fee? Or is that included with CMS Hub???
Should iframes not be used in rich text modules? I canâ€™t seem to remove the width/height attribute (resets on save)
No actually to achieve better overall performance
yeah this is the app, it would be nice if you can have a look at it and tell me what to improve : <https://www.deliverect.com/en-us/> :smile:
if you had MHE before april 1 then included. If not then it is in CMS Ent

Hi all, wondering if anyone can shed light on the Drift integration snippet and why it would stick around after removing it from apps and disabling the integration. Dug through all templates and still seeing it globally. Confirmed it's not coming from GTM or similar. Thanks!
check your domain level settings and also the global ones. deleting it from the domain doesnt remove it if it is at the global level too
Oh man, full Friday space-cadet over. Thank you!
What does your score and main thread work look like if you remove all site tags (ie Facebook pixel, linked in, google analytics, chat, etc)

<@UFBNA9K9A> If I'm using a 3rd party form and extracting that information and trying to post to the Forms API, how would I find the hutk ?
Something like this?
 var hutk = document.cookie.replace(/(?:(?:^|.*;\s*)HubSpotutk\s*\=\s*([^;]*).*$)|^.*$/, "$1")
yup that looks about right <@UK3KAAFRP>
Hi I am using <http://singer.io|singer.io> and HubSpot tap to extract data. Its giving me some errors on date parsing, can anyone help ?
still did not try that, but do you have any idea how to organize them in a way that make them load better in the app ?
